titleStmt.title: The resolution of the armie concerning the city of London, after their ending of the work at Colchester, and their declaration concerning the same. Also, two great fights at Colchester on Munday morning last; the first, between Generall Lucas with a party of horse and firelocks, against the Parliaments forces, upon their sallying out upon their guards: with the particulars of the fight, their advancing to the works, and playing their ordnance upon the Lord Generals Horse, and the killed and taken. The second, between the Colchesterian Shavers, and the Kentish-men, against the Suffolk forces, and the Lord Generals, upon their sallying out at Buttolphs Gate, and East Gate; with the numbers killed and taken, and the resolution of the Shavers concerning the Army.
titleStmt.author: Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)

notesStmt.note: Includes: The Kings Maiesties demands and proposals to the Parliament of England. Signed: Charles R.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
